name: Chicken Egg Drop Soup
description: This Chicken Egg Drop Soup is a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar delight, tailor-made for those who are watching their dietary intake but don't want to compromise on flavor. A hearty and healthy recipe, it's perfect for anyone looking to enjoy a nourishing meal that's both delicious and beneficial to their health.

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the vegetables by chopping the carrots, dicing the red onion, and mincing the garlic and ginger. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the chicken back portions and chicken livers under cold water, then set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add the chicken back portions and chicken livers. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook for about 30 minutes or until the chicken is fully cooked.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the chicken pieces from the broth. Once cool enough to handle, shred the meat from the bones and set the meat aside. Discard the bones and livers.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: In the same pot with the broth, add the chopped carrots, diced red onion, minced garlic, and ginger. Simmer for about 10 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk the egg in a bowl. Slowly pour the whisked egg into the simmering soup, stirring constantly to create egg ribbons. Cook for an additional 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Add the shredded chicken back into the pot. Stir well and continue to cook for another 5 minutes, ensuring the chicken is heated through.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7
